result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Teresa S Schaetz was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: CASH BOND APPLIED.  To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Court will convert up to half of this amount as community service at the rate of $8/hour.

- Order for Ignition Interlock Exemptions and Removing Title Transfer Stops 
- Reasons
Discharge Regular - 10/02/2020

Per Agent Katie Suwyn, the defendant has completed everything.  No PRH needed.
43
Letter from Sara Rhode (Dept of Health & Human Services) dated 10/09/2019 - defendant has completed the AODA assessment
Community Service Logs - 101 1/2 hours

1:08 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Holley not present in court.  Court quashes the warrant.  Statement by the Court - needs to address the community service.  Statement by the defendant - has completed a budget.  Court will allow the fines and costs to be paid via community service at a rate of $7.50 per hour.  Statement by defendant.  Further statement by the Court  - defendant still has 84 hours of community service to complete.  Statement by the defendant, will be also paying some cash.  Statement by defendant regarding sliding schedule, was informed to come in after May 1st due to switching insurance.  Statement by the Court - defendant needs to complete one of the AODA, does not matter which one, but one of them needs to be completed.

Court adjourned at 1:12 p.m.
Call from defendant reqeusting to schedule her PRH for tomorrow as she will have a ride.  Advised defendant PRH will be scheduled tomorrow at 1:00 p.m.

8:41 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Agent Holley Dornfeld present in court.  Court goes over message received from the defendant this morning, defendant called and was not able to make court today as she has no ride.  Statement by Agent Dornfeld, has not received a budget from the defendant.  Court authorizes a warrant stayed for a week.  Defendant to appear in Court before Friday at 4:30 p.m. or the warrant will be issued.

Court adjourned at 8:42 a.m.

Defendant phoned the office and said she cannot be here for her probation review hearing this morning because she does not have a ride.  Informed defendant that we would pass the message on to the Court.
Review hearing on April 22, 2019 at 08:30 am.

8:34 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Holley Dornfeld present in court.  Statement by the Court regarding community service, believes it was that the Court would convert up to half of the amount due.  Statement by defendant.  Statement by the Court.  Court questions defendant regarding budget.  Statement by defendant - confirms she has a budget.  Court requests defendant to submit a copy of the budget to the Court and also to her agent.  Court questions defendant regarding completion of AODA.  Statement by defendant has not completed an AODA, does not have the money to pay for it.  Court questions defendant if she contacted DHHS.  Statement by defendant - has not contacted them.  Statement by the Court - will contact DHHS to find out re cost of AODA.  Court sets for PRH on April 22, 2019 at 8:30 a.m.  Court extends probation to April 22, 2019 and finds defendant has not made a good faith effort.

Court adjourned at 8:39 a.m.
Letter to Judge Slate from the defendant with community service timesheets
Probation review hearing on March 25, 2019 at 08:30 am.
from Agent Holley Dornfeld dated 02/04/2019 re: request for probation review hearing to be scheduled

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Note:  Penalty portion of plea questionnaire was scanned as submitted, not real legible.

2:15 p.m  2:06 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Wesley Kottke.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement.  Atty Kottke concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court questions Atty Kottke.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1, dismiss and read in count 2 and dismisses count 3.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Kottke.  Statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

Count 1
-SWD and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS:

- 6 month county jail with Huber and out of county service and travel.  Court does not grant Huber release for child care at this time but may reconsider if anyone addresses the Court as to the need for defendant to provide child care services.
- $1,000 fine plus costs to be paid to the Clerk  of Court's Office during term of probation.  Court will convert up to half of this amount as community service at the rate of $8/hour. 
- 30 month DL revocation
- 30 month IID requirement
- AODA assessment and any follow up recommendations
- $42.50 blood draw fee
- DNA Sample

Court orders immediate remand to the custody of the Green Lake County Jail.

Count 2 dismissed and read in.  Court 2 dismissed.

Court adjourned 2:31 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 2, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

1:26 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Wesley Kottke.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Kottke - believes an agreement has been reached.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on October 2, 2017 at 2:00 p.m.  Court cancels the jury trial and no costs or fees assessed as it is within the time frame.

Court adjourned at 1:27 p.m.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.

2:20 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $100.00 cash bond bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Defendant qualifies for PD representation.  Court will set for Status Hearing on December 1, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:23 p.m.
